questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'Neither statement is true.'
questions.ex: 'Neither' is a distributive determiner, referring to neither one of two options.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'This is your problem, not mine.'
questions.ex: 'This' is a demonstrative determiner, pointing out which problem.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'I saw that movie last week.'
questions.ex: 'that' is a demonstrative determiner, specifying which movie.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'Give him his book.'
questions.ex: 'his' is a possessive determiner.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'We have enough time.'
questions.ex: 'enough' is a quantifier, indicating a sufficient amount of time.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'Which color do you prefer?'
questions.ex: 'Which' is an interrogative determiner, used to ask about a specific choice from a group.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'What a mess!'
questions.ex: 'a' is an indefinite article (determiner).

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'She was the first person to arrive.'
questions.ex: 'the' is a definite article (determiner), and 'first' is an ordinal numeral (determiner). 'The' is listed first in the options and is a clear determiner.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'There was little hope left.'
questions.ex: 'little' is a quantifier used with uncountable nouns to indicate a small amount (almost none).

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'There were few people at the meeting.'
questions.ex: 'few' is a quantifier used with countable nouns to indicate a small number (almost none).

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'Both my parents are doctors.'
questions.ex: 'Both' is a distributive determiner, referring to the two parents together.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'Some students are absent.'
questions.ex: 'Some' is a quantifier, indicating an unspecified number of students.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'I need that information.'
questions.ex: 'that' is a demonstrative determiner, specifying which information.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'Her cat is black.'
questions.ex: 'Her' is a possessive determiner.

questions.q: Identify the determiner in the sentence: 'Give me either book.'
questions.ex: 'either' is a distributive determiner, referring to one of two options.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most similar in meaning to 'Accept'.
questions.ex: 'Agree to take or do' is a definition of accept.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most similar in meaning to 'Assist'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most similar in meaning to 'Obtain'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Clean'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Loud'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Old'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Allow'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Accept'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Build'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Discover'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Arrive'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Obtain'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Artificial'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Increase'.

questions.q: Choose the word that is most opposite in meaning to 'Complex'.
questions.ex: 'Simple' means easily understood or done; presenting no difficulty.

questions.ex: A bibliography is a list of the books referred to in a scholarly work, typically printed as an appendix.

questions.q: A place where dead bodies are kept for identification.

questions.q: A group of stars.
questions.ex: A constellation is a group of stars forming a recognizable pattern that is traditionally named after its apparent form or identified with a mythological figure.

questions.q: A person who writes dictionaries.

questions.q: A place where animals are kept in their natural habitat.

questions.q: The art of beautiful handwriting.

questions.q: A person who is skilled in judging works of art.

questions.q: A person who is reserved and prefers to be alone.

questions.q: A person who looks on the bright side of things.

questions.q: A person who looks on the dark side of things.

questions.q: A place where goods are manufactured.

questions.q: A speech delivered without any previous preparation.

questions.q: A person who knows everything.

questions.q: A person who is present everywhere.

questions.q: One who has unlimited power.

questions.q: A person who can neither read nor write.

questions.q: A place where dead bodies are buried.

questions.q: A person who lives alone and avoids others.

questions.q: A person who is fond of company.
questions.ex: An extrovert is an outgoing, socially confident person.

questions.q: The study of ancient things.
questions.ex: Archaeology is the study of human history and prehistory through the excavation of sites and the analysis of artifacts and other physical remains.

questions.q: A set of twenty.

questions.q: A period of one hundred years.

questions.q: A person who is eighty years old.
questions.ex: An octogenarian is a person aged between 80 and 89 inclusive.

questions.q: A person who is ninety years old.

questions.q: A person who is one hundred or more years old.

questions.q: A place where money is kept.

questions.q: A person who does not believe in the existence of God.
